alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 07 at 3:09AM MST until March 09 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches, except 10 to 15 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes possible, especially in the Bear River Range. * WHERE...Emigration Summit, Wayan, Swan Valley, Victor, Ashton, Tetonia, and Driggs * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Some or all of these areas could be upgraded to Winter Storm Warnings later today or early Tuesday morning. Be prepared for significant snowfall accumulations in these areas.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range; Teton Valley
